questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

Drag and drop the phases of TrustSec from the left onto the targets on the right. Not all options are used.

//IMG//

comments.content:
Thank you for this! Agreed the correct answer is 
Target 1. Classification
Target 2. Propagation
Target 3. Enforcement

discussion.content:
correct is target 
1: classification
target 2: propagation
target 3: enforcement

source https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/sec_usr_cts/configuration/xe-16/sec-usr-cts-xe-16-book/sec-usr-cts-xe-16-book_chapter_01101.pdf

questions.question_text: Which type of route represents prefixes received from a local site via an SD-WAN Edge router in a Cisco SD-WAN architecture?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
OMP routes, or vRoutes, are prefixes that are learned from the local site, or service side, of a WAN Edge router. 

Service routes represent services (firewall, IPS, application optimization, etc.) that are connected to the
WAN Edge local-site network and are available for other sites for use with service insertion. 

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/solutions/CVD/SDWAN/cisco-sdwan-design-guide.pdf

"D" is corrcet.
In Cisco SD-WAN, service routes represent prefixes (or routes) that are learned from the local site and advertised by the SD-WAN Edge router to the SD-WAN fabric.

questions.question_text: A customer requires reliability for voice traffic and has MPLS, biz-internet, and public-internet transports. Which control policy configuration maintains a better SLA and avoids blackholing of voice traffic?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Correct answer is C cause it has backup transport is configured

Selected Answer: B
B is right as well. If the preferred colour doesn't match the sla class, traffic will go through any tunnel that match the sla-class. If no tunnel match the sla-class, traffic will go through any available tunnel. C option just added backup-sla-preferred-color but B is good enough to meet the requirement in the question.
C is the correct answer since the question is to avoid black hauling, we must have a backup path. Option B is with only MPLS

questions.question_text: A network engineer configures QoS on a WAN Edge router to use a default bandwidth of 6K downstream and 8K upstream. The actual bandwidth in use must adjust dynamically according to the current available WAN bandwidth. Which configuration must the engineer apply?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
qos-adaptive
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/qos/ios-xe-17/qos-book-xe/m-adaptive-qos.html#Cisco_Concept.dita_251a0d8e-7cad-46e1-a777-b3c883cd7083
Answer C

choices.D: The TCP connection is established between the client and the proxy, and between the proxy and the server.
choices.A: The sender authenticates the devices and individual users, and the receiver verifies the signature by decrypting the message with the public key of the sender.
choices.C: When decryption policy is enabled for the flow, a client hello packet is received by Unified Threat Defense to define the decryption action.
choices.B: Certificate authorities in TLS Proxy issue certificates for authentication to all entitles such as hosts, network devices, or users.

questions.question_text: What is the first step for setting up traffic flows when enabling TLS Proxy in SD-WAN for security?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
This is how traffic flows when TLS proxy is enabled:
1: A TCP connection is established between the client and the proxy, and the proxy and the server.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/security/ios-xe-17/security-book-xe/m-ssl-proxy.html
